pullRequest.title: [nikobus] fixed refresh handling
pullRequest.bodyText:
fixed refresh handing due channelLinked not called anymore on startup for example (similar to openhab/openhab-core#1707),
"Impacted Modules" can be empty if button is configured as "standalone" and does not impact modules,
minor doc fix

Signed-off-by: Boris Krivonog boris.krivonog@inova.si

commit.message:
* fixed refresh handing due `channelLinked` not called anymore on startup for example (similar to https://github.com/openhab/openhab-core/issues/1707),
* "Impacted Modules" can be empty if button is configured as "standalone" and does not impact modules,
* minor doc fix

Signed-off-by: Boris Krivonog <boris.krivonog@inova.si>

* "Impacted Modules" can be empty if button is configured as "standalone" and does not impact modules,
* minor doc fix

Signed-off-by: Boris Krivonog boris.krivonog@inova.si

afterCommit.message:
* fixed refresh handing due `channelLinked` not called anymore on startup for example (similar to https://github.com/openhab/openhab-core/issues/1707),

Signed-off-by: Boris Krivonog <boris.krivonog@inova.si>

nodes.bodyText:
Is it expected for the impactedModules to contain ThingUIDs for things that might not actually exist?
What is the expected behavior if the config contains a thing that doesn't exist?
You can check the validity of a thingUID by iterating through all of the things under a bridge using getBridge().getThings().
That said I don't know what your requirements are here.

commit.message:
* check if configured impacted module for `impactedModules` is referencing an existing thing,
* fixed warnings

Signed-off-by: Boris Krivonog <boris.krivonog@inova.si>
